item.description: My goal is to build robust machine learning models capable of solving real-world problems on the same performance level as our brain. On this path, my current research is concerned with domain adaptation and transfer learning. Other research interests include semi-supervised learning in domains with little labeled data, the cross-section between machine learning and computational neuroscience and philosophical questions in AI research. For my Master’s thesis, I am currently working on “Domain Adaptation in Brains and Machines” with Matthias Bethge at the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems in Tübingen.

item.description: 2018 Starting in April, I am joining the Bethge Lab at the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems in Tübingen for my Master’s thesis on “Domain Adaptation in Brains and Machines”. I recently gave a popular science talk on Unsupervised Learning at 15x4 Munich. 2017 Our paper “Towards Desynchronization Detection in Biosignals” with methods during my internship with Caroline Li and Yike Guo was accepted to the NIPS Time Series Workshop 2018.
